intro: Tarenna sambucina var. glabra, commonly known as the smooth tarenna, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its glabrous (smooth) stems and leaves. The plant produces small, clustered white flowers that are typically followed by small, oval-shaped berries. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
